title: Jittery shoppers help deflate consumer credit boom
text:
Growing political chaos over Brexit took further heat out of the consumer credit boom in September, as lending to jittery households slowed to its weakest pace for five years.

Growth in consumer credit slipped to 6pc year-on-year last month as the surge in household borrowing continues to unwind, Bank of England data revealed.

Total borrowing by individuals slid back to £4.6bn, holding above a three-year monthly low in May, while growth in credit card lending slowed sharply to a five-year low of 4.4pc.

The consumer credit boom has eased off in the past three years, after the Bank warned high street lenders of “pockets of risk” in credit cards amid concern over long deals where customers paid...
